item.title: So many sites!
item.description: There has been a major influx of new sites lately. Roughly a year ago we only had 300 or so active sites. Now we are over double that at 612!

item.title: rss feed
item.description: My blog now has a working rss feed.

item.title: Tmux vs screen
item.description: Which is the best? There is an answer! They are both awesome!

item.title: Comments
item.description: Yep, comments still work. But, I have ro remember to check them as everything is manual. Not the best solution, I agree.

item.title: zzz.i2p
item.description: Whelp, zzz.i2p has been down for over a day now. Did something break?

item.title: Why?
item.description: What does notbob exist?

item.title: My van
item.description: In one of the comments someone asked me about my van. Yes, I have a van. It's a normal van. Full sized. No bathroom, no shower. Poop in a bucket kind of thing. I can't even stand up inside it. Have you ever tried to put on pants when you can't stand up? You get good at it after a while, but it never really feels right. There are many good things about living in a van.

item.title: karamba.i2p
item.description: For some reason that I can't fathom karamba.i2p now responds to pings. I have no idea how to explain this.

item.title: karamba.i2p
item.description: Host karamba.i2p appears to be dead in my site list, yet it still works. That's odd. It's a site I use once in a while to see what people are talking about over on the russian IRC server.

item.title: jerryblog.i2p
item.description: There is no point in linking to it as the site is dead. This is a major issue with the "DNS" system we use. Once a site is registed it exists forever. Sites like jerryblog.i2p were online for a very short time and now are gone forever.

item.title: Comments are possibly broken for now.
item.description: It seems to be an underlying bug in the way java i2p handles b32 links. I've worked out a solution, but have yet to implement it. I plan to have that rolled out here before too long.

item.title: vern.i2p
item.description: vern.i2p just threw a bunch of useful tools into the I2P network. This is pretty awesome. I'm going to highlight a few of the tools.

item.title: Comments
item.description: You can now comment on my blog. Note that once comments are submitted there will be a major delay in them showing up. I tar pit them till they can be read. I imagine there will be quite a bit of spam.

item.title: Random image
item.description: Image

item.title: New categories
item.description: Thanks to the help of Dr|Z we now have two new categories to classify sites under. I can code, but I'm shit for graphic design.

item.title: Random Pictures
item.description: Pictures

item.title: Made In Abyss
item.description: This show is awesome. You should watch it.

item.title: Torrents
item.description: Please be kind and don't just snatch and run with torrents. Seed for a while after your download is done. It makes it faster for any new people who want to download.

description.b: How to setup the StormyCloud and Purokishi.i2p I2P outproxies for android.

item.title: Torrents
item.description: As at least one of you noticed, torrents that I own on postman have died. There was a hardware failure. Much driving was done. It's fixed now.

item.title: Unicode
item.description: notbob.i2p does not currently support unicode. This is a problem.

item.title: Clearnet mirrors
item.description: There have been an influx of new sites recently. Several of them are unofficial mirrors of news sites. But, wait, there is more!

item.title: Consciousness
item.description: Not all humans have a inner monologue.

item.title: Nowhere
item.description: If you need me, I'll be boondocking out in the desert.

item.title: ATTN: Keven Hendricks
item.description: Thanks :)

item.title: Pay attention Keven
item.description: I will be making a long post here in the next few days. It will be exciting.

item.title: Dread
item.description: Dread now has an i2p site. You can find it here. They have opted to not use an addressbook entry. Here is the quote.

item.title: Downtime and Multihoming
item.description: As you will notice from the graphs, I had some major downtime on my main router. But, thanks to Multihoming all my services were still working. Granted, data was frozen in place and not updated, but jumps worked, graphs continued to show the most recent data they had.

item.title: A news site appears!
item.description: Out of nowhere, what looks like a legit replacement for deepdotweb appears! It's http://darknetdaily.i2p

item.title: notbob in the news
item.description: There was an atricle over at cybersocialhub.com that mentions my site! Pretty cool.

item.title: Minesweeper
item.description: I wrote a minesweeper game as a refresher on how to use svg files.

item.title: Site detection
item.description: I've yet again improved site detection. It may work better now.

item.title: I2Pd users, please upgrade
item.description: Please upgrade to 2.41.0

item.title: isitdown.i2p
item.description: I'm not privy to the details, but isitup.i2p is down. It has been for a while. Sometimes it works, but not often. It's sad.

item.title: New sites
item.description: New site detection was broken for a couple days. It seems to be working again.

item.title: i2p is broken
item.description: Not really borken, but yeah. There are some issues right now that will be fixed with the next release. My i2pd routers are currently working better than the i2p stock routers. i2p+ routers are running better than those, but but quite as well as i2pd.

item.title: i2pd - jumping
item.description: I was browisng i2p via one of my i2pd routers today when I noticed that a site I wanted to visit wasn't in my addressbook on that router. Annoying. So, I used a jump site. i2pd offers three jump services. identiguy.i2p, reg.i2p and stats.i2p.

item.title: Outage
item.description: I seem to have had an outage. Sorry about that. Anyway, due to the multi-home nature of my site the jump services and any other lookup services were still working.

item.title: Retrospect
item.description: We are up to almost 500 working eepsites. This is roughly double the number that were around when I started doing this. It's great. I like i2p. I think it has a future. I also like the way it works better than tor. Truly decentralized. At least the underlying system. There are aspects that sadly are single point failure. Though, these are more service specific than anything else. Not everyone has the means to multi-home a site, and even if they do the back end tends to have a single point of failure.

item.title: Clearnet
item.description: Someone made a clearnet proxy page for my site. notbob.onion.dog - WARNING CLEARNET

item.title: Jump requests
item.description: Here is a breakdown of the 2021 not_bob jumpsite requests.

item.title: Argh
item.description: This is how I feel today.

item.title: Oops
item.description: Looks like I've found another bug. It's been fixed and will propagate to the other routers running notbob soon enough.

item.title: Privacy
item.description: major.acetone.i2p shows IRC logs from places that have influence in the direction of i2p. Good or bad, it's best to assume that everything you do using someone else's equipment is logged. This is one of the reasons why i2p works. It uses the idea that every other node you are talking to might be compromised.

item.title: teddit
item.description: Teddit is a super useful tool. I am really glad it's here.

item.title: Multihoming
item.description: notbob has been multihomed for a while now. This is a good practice for others to follow. Not only does it allow your eepsite to be more reachable, but it prevents correlation attacks with router uptime.

item.title: Hidden Services
item.description: In regards to the following.

item.title: i2p scrutiny
item.description: You should take the time to read this.

item.title: dead.i2p
item.description: It's funny that dead.i2p is not working.

item.title: fakeboobs.i2p
item.description: Someone really wants that site to exist. They searched for it using my tool countless times today.

item.title: i2pd
item.description: I've spent quite a bit of time working with i2pd. I'm pretty impressed at how easy it was to setup and get services working on it. In some ways it was much simpler than the offical java i2p. It is also really nice for resource usage. I am able to run it on machines with half a gig of ram. I've still got ram to spare. It also compiles nicely on FreeBSD.

item.title: Alone time
item.description: This isn't something that I get much of anymore. Having a family will do that. Back when I hooked up with my wife we didn't spend every hour together. We still had some "personal time". It wasn't so bad before the child, but now it's just "Well, there goes that plan..."

item.title: On children
item.description: I had never expected to be a father. Now, due to events that are beyond my grasp. Well. No. I know exactly how it happened. Tab A into slot B.

item.title: Nothing of value
item.description: The last number of sites to pop up have nothing useful to offer. It's a sad state of affairs.

item.title: That was special.
item.description: kilos.i2p shocked me when I was doing my "What is this" scan. It's a drug/whatever market. Nothing special. But, what is special is the captcha. Parts of naked people with a tor address attached to the body. That really got me! Totally unique! I love it.

item.title: Tarpitting
item.description: In the near future we will be tarpitting new sites. They will still show up in the page, but they won't be included in the hosts.txt right away. As it turns out, there was a new rather not cool site to come up.

item.title: Bad day
item.description: It seems that everything is going wrong today. This has been a very bad day so far. And, well. It's just started.

item.title: Multihoming
item.description: Some progress has been made in multihoming. More later.

item.title: notbob the unstable
item.description: Here we go again. More downtime. Yep. If it's not one thing, it's another.

item.title: Madness
item.description: Lots of things broke. It's bad. But, that's why we have backups.

item.title: Downtime
item.description: Yep. It happens. Had to drive for almost two days to go fix a problem. We are back up now. Also, it looks like I may need to look into multi-homing notbob so this doens't happen again.

item.title: Counter
item.description: The counter on my site has been broken for a while. It only supported four digits. I did a quick fix a while back that caused it to just "roll over" back to zero every time it hit 9999. It still kept track of the real number.

item.title: Downtime
item.description: Oops. Something ate all my megabytes. That sucks.

item.title: isitup.i2p
item.description: This site brings up it's own question. Is it up? Yes, the site is up. No. It does not appear to be working quite right. It appears to be reporting sites as down that are very much not down. This includes my own. But, other famous sites such as zzz.i2p show as down there as well.

item.title: 0xff.i2p
item.description: This site looks fun. It appears to be a file upload that you operate via the command line. That's clever and would make batch operations simple. A welcome addition to i2p!

item.title: reddit / onions
item.description: I've been notified that my site is on the sidebar on the i2p/reddit group. That's pretty cool.

item.title: Wall of shame.
item.description: I found these searches in the jump logs today.

item.title: UI update!
item.description: dr|z3d was good enough to update the css on my site to do the thing that I wanted to do. Now, instead of having a list of site types, there are icons. This is what I wanted to do from the start, but had no idea how to do. I'm not very good at css yet. Though, I have improved quite a bit from a skill level of zero.

item.title: More sorting!
item.description: Well, Defcon has had a bit of an upgrade. You can now sort by category. Try it out.

item.title: Sorting
item.description: I'm going to leave this, this and this here. More details will come later.

item.title: fakeboobs.i2p
item.description: There is no site named fakeboobs.i2p! Whoever keeps searching for it can keep searching for it though. It makes me laugh.

item.title: New sites!
item.description: There are so many new sites this week! Too bad most of them are pretty worthless. They either have no real content, or they ping, but don't do anything else.

item.title: Long hostnames!
item.description: Someone decided to create a hostname that was so long that it made all my graphs look silly. It sucked.

item.title: i2pjump.i2p
item.description: It seems that i2pjump.i2p is having issues.

item.title: def3.i2p
item.description: As you can see from the graph below, the Dancing Elephants Forum has been down for a while.

item.title: Graphs!
item.description: I now have yearly graphs. They will be run on the first of each month. They provide some curious results.

item.title: yiffme.i2p
item.description: Yiffme.i2p continues to make me happy. I thank the creator.

item.title: searx.i2p
item.description: searsx.i2p seems like a decent little search engine. I'm glad to have it on the network.

item.title: Really!?
item.description: Things continue to go south. I'll be fine. Don't worry, and the site monitor will continue to function. I'm also still paying attention.

item.title: Too many things.
item.description: As of late I've had too many things going on and I can't handle it. It's driving me nuts. The stress level is through the roof.

item.title: proof-of-loss.i2p
item.description: Just like any other i2p site, I have no idea who runs it. But, wow. That was amusing. It came online, I was able to see the content. It wasn't much. Just a message about a whitepaper coming soon. Then it was gone two hours later.

item.title: Updates
item.description: There have been chnages on the site. A nice search bar and other visual tweaks. Thank you dr|z3d for the help on that.

item.title: Children / Stats
item.description: Having a child on the way changes a person looks at life. It's changed many of the things I do and the reasons I do them.

item.title: hosts.txt
item.description: My hosts.txt has been popular! About 300 pulls a day now. My hosts-all.txt is even more popular at over 700 pulls a day!

item.title: Graphs!
item.description: I'm going to be making graphs for the the results of my jumpsite soon. I think it's going to replace the notbob graph that shows up on the front page. I'm still working out what details I want to include.

item.title: cake.i2p
item.description: He called it cake.i2p knowing people like cake.

item.title: Jump bugs!
item.description: There was a bug found in my jump service. This has been fixed. It had to do with people who use .i2p in parts of the hostname that are not the tld.

item.title: tracker2.postman.i2p
item.description: It seems tracker2.postman.i2p has been a bit unstable as of late. I'm sure I'm not the only one who is sad because of this.

item.title: Jump service!
item.description: I'm now an offical jump service for i2p mainline! This is pretty cool.

item.title: No prizes for second place!
item.description: More changes to the jumpsite. Better, smarter, all that.

item.title: Bugfix and new jump!
item.description: I am now using http://notbob.i2p/cgi-bin/jump.cgi?q=site.i2p as the offical jump. Somehow doing this caused arguments to fail to pass on. This has been fixed.

item.title: Updates!
item.description: There have been more changes to the code. Smarter scanning. Though, it looks like some of that code may be thrown away. There will be much discussion.

item.title: i2p!
item.description: I have some good news too! It's possible that I might become an offical jump service. I'm looking forward to that. I want to help this project out as I care about it.

item.title: Bad day.
item.description: Some bad things happened today that I can't talk about. But, don't worry. I'm fine and so is my special someone.

item.title: Growing pains
item.description: Some days are better than others. This is not one of the better ones.

item.title: It didn't break!
item.description: So, yeah. It didn't break and I got the results I expected. This was a good move and will help the site be more responsive to changes in the future.

item.title: Rollout!
item.description: Code has been updated and is live. Lets see how badly it breaks. New site detection and encryption detection has been improved.

item.title: ElG, ls2 and ecies
item.description: I'm working on a new way to deal with data I collect in regards to the type of encryption that's used for a site. How it's stored. How it's processed. This will result in better results for you, the end user in knowing what the network looks like.

item.title: Postman
item.description: Postman's tracker has recently had a major privacy improvement! Now, instead of showing the first part of tunnel names in swarms it shows "Seeder 1", Seeder 2", 'leacher 1", "Leacher 2".

item.title: ECIES detection
item.description: ECIES detection appears to be mostly working at this point. I've done some more fiddeling around with the code.

item.title: 301 sites!
item.description: It's possible that I'm wrong. But, for the first time that I've noticed we are now over 300 active eepsites with valid domains. I know there are more that just use a .b32 address. But, I don't track those. They tend to pop in and out of service quickly. Hence, I only track sites that offer a valid domain name. I take this to mean that the operator is serious about what they are doing and the content they are serving.

item.title: A new year, bugs
item.description: Happy new year. I'm glad you didn't die.

item.title: ECIES is broken.
item.description: Pings with ECIES and ElG don't seem to work right. I have been banging my head on the wall for the last few hours. I'll get it to work eventually. Enough for tonight.

item.title: Things work!
item.description: This node continues to work even with 5000 hosts to scan! I can handle more. Don't work harder. Write smarter code.

item.title: Graphs fixed.
item.description: After much testing the graphs all seem to be fixed and data collection is back to normal.

item.title: Graphs broken
item.description: Not totally broken mind you. But, I added "all the hosts" that zzz offered. We will see if we get anything new. So far, nothing.

item.title: Jump bugfix
item.description: I have fixed another bug in the jump program. Easy fix, but it prevented the services from working as expected in specific use cases.

item.title: hosts.txt
item.description: I now have two host.txt files. One for safe sites only and another that has everything.

item.title: RIP Hiddenbooru
item.description: As you can see from my jump page hiddenbooru is dead and has been for a while now. This makes me sad.

item.title: Leave
item.description: As much as I love i2p, I will not be able to spend much time here for a while. Life has been too full of "problems" that take up too much of my time. This does not mean that I'm leaving. I just won't be around much. I will still work on improvements, but at an even slower pace then before. Services will continue to run and be checked at least once a day to make sure they are running.

item.title: Failure
item.description: Birth control sometimes fails. Well. Shit.

item.title: Snowden
item.description: Snowden is a hero. That is all.

item.title: I'm safe.
item.description: I've not been active as of late. Lots of stuff going on in life. I haven't had time to do any programming for i2p as of late. Don't worry. I do check on my services several times a day "Yep, it still works". But, I haven't had time to do any more than that.

item.title: Lease Set 1
item.description: Lease Set 1 is dead! Let the bells ring! We are now on the Lease Set 2 for the standard! As of today I note that there is not a single LS1 eepsite detected by my scanner. This is very good news.

item.title: Good, bad?
item.description: I got added to the links page of linuxfarm.i2p! This makes me very happy.

item.title: Falling out
item.description: I've been busy working on a real life project as of late. Nothing to see here.

item.title: More changes
item.description: I have made some more backend changes to defcon that allow it to work with the new version of i2p+ which you can, and should get here. These changes are very low level and would not otherwise be noticed by the average user. But, they were enough to break things.

item.title: Tor v2 onion support
item.description: Please read this about tor v2 onion addresses. If you are running any v2 onion addresses you should move them over to v3. This really matters.

item.title: Trump has Rona
item.description: Well, Trump has Covid-19. I hope he dies.

item.title: Updates!
item.description: I have made more backend updates to defcon. It now does a better job of detecting new sites. As you can see here there are a number of new sites. Note, that if you read this later on this may not be true as it's a real time display.

item.title: Suck internet.
item.description: Living a mobile lifestyle often means shitty internet. Today has been one of those days. Not only is it slow, but it's unreliable.

item.title: Not dead
item.description: I'm still alive. I've just been stupid busy as of late.

item.title: Downtime
item.description: There was some downtime today. It sucked. Should be fixed now. Don't blame me. Blame the guy behind the other curtain.

item.title: Cleanup
item.description: More code cleanup. Thank you Dr|z3d. Site should be a little faster now with smaller html output. Other bug fixes that nobody else will ever notice.

item.title: Youtube
item.description: Someone featured my page on youtube. Too bad I can't understand a word he is saying. Here is the link. If someone could help me with a translation, even roughly that would be great.

item.title: Menu system
item.description: I have put in place a simple menu system for the microblog. It seems to work.

item.title: Blog
item.description: Raw html is a pain. So, I wrote a microblog to handle my blogging needs.

item.title: i2p content
item.description: i2p hosts soome rather bland sites for the most part.

item.title: Updates
item.description: My defcon program now displays ping times in the tooltips. This has been a vexing bug for a while. The problem turned out to be something rather silly.

item.title: Porn on i2p.
item.description: In my many adventures on the i2p network I have found very little porn. This is a bit of a shock. What I have found has been mostly pretty borning. The usual stuff you find on the clearnet. Then, lots and lots of scat porn. Adult babies, diaper fetish and whatnot. Is this really the best we have to offer?! I want something I've never seen before. You know. Girl on girl on girl on girl on girl on guy on sheep.

item.title: The state of the network
item.description: This network was founded in 2003, 17 years ago. Yet there are from what I can tell just shy of 300 active sites. Why is this? Also, most of them look like they were written all of 17 years ago. An eepsite can look good and still be small. Most of the pages on my site even with images are under 30k for everything. It can be done.

item.title: Why?
item.description: Why did I write the defcon program? I did it because it was fun. I like to make things that are useful and fun. Not only that, but I was having trouble finding useful content on i2p. This tool allows us all to see what content is public.
